L-1.title: Understanding SAT Question Types
L-1.description: A comprehensive guide covering key verbal and math question types on the SAT.

detail_content.text: This document covers essential strategies for mastering SAT reading comprehension.

L-2.title: Mastering SAT Reading Strategies
L-2.description: Effective techniques to approach SAT reading passages with confidence.

detail_content.text: This document provides essential strategies for tackling SAT reading passages, including time management tips, active reading techniques, and common question types with sample answers.

L-3.title: Essential SAT Vocabulary List
L-3.description: A list of high-frequency words that commonly appear in SAT exams.

detail_content.text: This document contains a curated list of high-frequency SAT vocabulary words, along with their definitions and example sentences to help students improve their reading and writing scores.

L-4.title: Math Practice: Mixed Problems
L-4.description: A set of exercises covering various math concepts tested on the SAT.

detail_content.question: What is the value of x if 2x + 5 = 15?
Which of the following is a prime number?
If a triangle has sides of length 3, 4, and 5, what type of triangle is it?
Solve for y: 3y - 7 = 2y + 5
What is the area of a circle with radius 6?

L-5.title: SAT Algebra & Advanced Math Drill
L-5.description: Targeted practice for algebra and advanced math problems.

detail_content.question: Solve for x: 4x - 3 = 13
What is the sum of the roots of the quadratic equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0?
If f(x) = 2x² - 3x + 1, find f(2)
What is the vertex of the parabola y = x² - 4x + 3?
If log₂x = 3, what is the value of x?

L-6.title: SAT Vocabulary Flashcards Set 1
L-6.description: Flashcards for learning and memorizing essential SAT vocabulary words.

detail_content.information: To reduce in amount, degree, or severity.
Harsh, jarring noise.
To reduce in strength.
Excessively talkative.
Extremely careful and precise.

L-7.title: Key SAT Writing & Math Concepts
L-7.description: A breakdown of essential writing and math principles for the SAT.

detail_content.text: This document covers fundamental SAT writing and math concepts, including grammar rules, algebra, and problem-solving strategies to boost test performance.

L-8.title: Data Analysis & Problem Solving
L-8.description: Exercises focused on problem-solving and data analysis skills for the SAT.

detail_content.question: A survey of 100 students found that 60% prefer coffee over tea. How many students prefer coffee?
The median of the data set {3, 7, 8, 12, 15} is:
If the mean of five numbers is 20 and four of the numbers are 18, 22, 19, and 21, what is the missing number?
A store's revenue increased by 25% from $8000 last month. What is the new revenue?
If a dataset has a standard deviation of 5, what happens if each value in the set is multiplied by 2?

L-9.title: SAT Vocabulary Flashcards Set 2
L-9.description: A continuation of essential SAT vocabulary flashcards for test prep.

detail_content.information: A deviation from what is normal or expected.
Well-meaning and kindly.
Fundamentally different; entirely unlike.
Intended for or understood by only a small group.
The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.

L-10.title: Top SAT Test-Taking Tips
L-10.description: Proven strategies to maximize efficiency and accuracy on the SAT.

detail_content.text: This document provides expert-backed SAT test-taking strategies, including time management, question prioritization, and elimination techniques to improve accuracy and confidence.

L-49.title: Grammar Rules Flashcards
L-49.description: Flashcards covering key grammar and standard English conventions.

detail_content.information: Subjects and verbs must agree in number (singular vs. plural).
A comma alone cannot join two independent clauses; use a conjunction or semicolon.
A pronoun must agree with its antecedent in number and gender.
Elements in a list or comparison must be in the same grammatical form.
Modifiers should be placed next to the word they modify to avoid confusion.

L-50.title: Algebra Problem Set
L-50.description: Practice questions focusing on key algebraic concepts for the SAT.

detail_content.question: Solve for x: 2x + 4 = 10
Factorize: x² - 5x + 6
Find the slope of the line passing through (1, 2) and (4, 8).
Solve: 3x² - 12 = 0
What is the y-intercept of the equation y = 3x + 5?

L-51.title: Understanding SAT Reading Structures
L-51.description: A guide to analyzing SAT reading passages and their structures.

detail_content.text: This document explains the different passage structures in the SAT Reading section, including narrative, argumentative, and informational texts, with strategies for identifying main ideas and key details.

L-52.title: Advanced Math SAT Practice
L-52.description: Challenging practice questions covering advanced math topics.

detail_content.question: If 2^x = 32, what is the value of x?
Evaluate the determinant of the matrix [[3, 2], [1, 4]].
The sum of the infinite geometric series 8 + 4 + 2 + ... is:
If f(x) = x³ - 3x² + 2x, find f(2).
Find the derivative of f(x) = 5x² - 3x + 7.
Ken is gay

L-53.title: SAT Vocab Flashcards Set 3
L-53.description: A final set of SAT vocabulary flashcards for enhanced preparation.

detail_content.information: Exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
Present or existing everywhere.
Characterized by vulgar or pretentious display.
To make someone less angry or hostile.
A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.

L-54.title: SAT Preparation Guide
L-54.description: General tips and guidance on structuring your SAT preparation.

detail_content.text: This guide provides a structured approach to preparing for the SAT, including study schedules, recommended resources, and test-day strategies to optimize performance.
